title: The Bright-Meyler Papers: A Bristol-West India Connection, 1730-1840
abstractText: This project is a critical edition, with substantial introductory commentary, of documents pertaining to the West Indian commercial and plantation interests of two Bristol families connected through marriage and business. The documents include correspondence, accounts, wills and inventories, partnership agreements, insurance policies and property deeds that illuminate better than most surviving sources the Jamaican end of British merchant firms engaged in West India trade when Jamaica was the wealthiest territory in Britain's Atlantic empire. The introductory analysis focuses on issues contained in the documents connected with slavery and the slave trade, capital accumulation, and the risk environment of the Caribbean.
